intro: Heinekenia peliorhyncha var. subglabrata, commonly known as the smooth-leaved heinekenia, is a rare plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are smooth and glabrous, giving it its varietal name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
